name: everfrost hat
notes:
designed with comfort and joy in mind, the everfrost hat is decorated in beautiful columns of simple cables with a traditional 2x2 folded brim. thoughtful decreases subtly evoke the silhouette of a snowflake on the crown. this hat takes just one skein of your favorite worsted-weight yarn, and to add a touch of magic, you can add a strand of a silk/mohair blend. 

**sizes**
one size

**finished measurements**
**brim circumference (unstretched)**
18” / 45.5 cm
**height (with brim unfolded)**
11.25” / 28.5 cm 

**yarn**	
**sample 1 (white version)**
universal yarn deluxe worsted (100% wool; 100g/220 yds) – 1 skein of 12257 pulp
lana gatto silk mohair (75% superkid mohair, 25% silk; 25g/232 yds) – 1 ball of 6028 cream

sample 2 (green version)
hudson & west co. forge (70% merino, 30% corriedale; 100g/235 yds) – 1  skein of evergreen

*or*
approx. 201 yds / 184 meters of any worsted-weight wool yarn

**needles**
us size 7 (4.5 mm) 16” circular and set of dpns (or a long circular for magic loop) for main hat pattern, *or size needed to obtain gauge*
us size 6 (4 mm) 16” circular (or a long circular for magic loop) for ribbing, *or one size smaller than the needle used to obtain gauge*

**notions**	
six stitch markers (one unique marker to denote the bor), cable needle, tapestry needle

**gauge**	
24 sts x 27 rnds = 4” / 10 cm in main hat pattern with larger needles
*always use the needle size that results in the correct gauge. gently wash and block your swatch before measuring.* 

**pattern notes**
this hat is knit seamlessly from the bottom up. it begins with the cast-on method of your choice. i used a long-tail tubular cast-on with stitches rearranged for 2x2 ribbing – there are many tutorials available for this method. other excellent options could include the german-twisted or cable cast-on methods, though a long-tail cast-on would work just fine as well. the crown decreases are worked into the cables – please read the special abbreviations section carefully.     

this hat is intended to be worn with 1-4” / 2.5-10 cm of negative ease.
